What is meant by a bodhisattva who pierces through the precious mind of omniscience without destroying it?

It means that a bodhisattva, regarding that mind of omniscience, does not grasp at anything, does not cling to anything, does not abide in anything, does not emerge from anything, does not enter into anything, has no conceptual proliferation, has no discrimination, destroys all discrimination, and does not establish anything. One should use right wisdom to contemplate the profound Dharma as it is in reality.
What is meant by the profound Dharma?
It refers to the Dharma that accords with dependent origination.

Realizing that there is no cause or object, not ceasing or permanent, far removed from extreme views, the self-nature of no-self and self-naturelessness, therefore all dharmas also have no self-nature.
All dharmas originally arise without arising, understanding emptiness, believing in signlessness, wishlessness, and non-seeking, in true wisdom there is nothing to create.

Ultimately impermanent, form is like foam, feeling is like a floating bubble, perception is like a mirage, mental formations are like a plantain tree, consciousness is like an illusory dharma, the elements have no movement, the sense bases arise from each other, the mind has no abode and also no thought, in the supreme activity it is not the supreme activity, in the equal dharma one truly understands, with various aspects all the same single flavor, and all abide in the path of the single vehicle.
Cultivating the wisdom of practicing the path depends on the supreme truth, using wisdom to understand the meaning without attachment.
All sounds are understood to be not sounds, and wisdom knows all sounds because past and future are cut off.

The wisdom of words and meanings enters non-duality, directly realizing the inexpressible meaning of all dharmas. The meaning of no-self is the wisdom of suffering, the ultimate meaning is the wisdom of accumulation, the meaning of non-coalescence is the wisdom of cessation, and the equal realization of conditioned and unconditioned is the wisdom of the path.

Separating from past and future is mindfulness of the body, arising and ceasing without abiding is mindfulness of feelings, observing without an object is mindfulness of mind, and the meaning of the equality of the dharma realm and non-realm is mindfulness of dharmas.
The meaning of mastery of mind is the four right efforts, being free from all obstructions is the four bases of supernatural powers.

translated: The meaning of arising is the faculty of faith, being without thought is the faculty of zeal, being without intention is the faculty of mindfulness, transcending frivolous discourse is the faculty of concentration, and being without reliance on others is the faculty of wisdom.

The power of faith is to have unobstructed objects, the power of diligence is to penetrate all powers, the power of mindfulness is to abide in mental stillness, the power of concentration is to be unmoved, and the power of wisdom is to be mindful of all things.

The factor of enlightenment of mindfulness is to be equally associated with all dharmas, the factor of enlightenment of investigation of phenomena is to neither emerge nor enter, the factor of enlightenment of diligence is to be without possessiveness, the factor of enlightenment of joy is to abide well in body and mind, the factor of enlightenment of pliancy is to be enlightened equally, the factor of enlightenment of concentration is to be free from dualistic dharmas, and the factor of enlightenment of equanimity is to be free from all views.

All discriminations and non-discriminations are free from all conceptual proliferations, which is right view. The equal and penetrating understanding of all sounds is right thought. The separation from mental and physical phenomena is right speech. The attainment of ease in all activities is called right action. The absence of high and low is right livelihood. The equal abiding of good and evil after their establishment is right effort. The equal and penetrating understanding of the mental objects is right mindfulness. The marvelous Å›amatha of peaceful abiding is right concentration.

The meaning of non-arising in regard to views and non-views is the meaning of impermanence. The meaning of originally unborn is the meaning of suffering. The meaning of no activity is the meaning of no-self. The meaning of cessation is the meaning of quiescence.

Subduing the mind is the meaning of giving, abiding in the nature of coolness is the meaning of upholding precepts, following the extinction of dharmas is the meaning of patience, being able to discern all dharmas is the meaning of vigor, calming the inner mind is the meaning of meditation, and knowing the signlessness of all dharmas as they really are is the meaning of wisdom.

The original purity of all sentient beings is the meaning of kindness, being equal to space is the meaning of compassion, the non-attainment of joy is the meaning of joy, and the ultimate completion of all undertakings is the meaning of equanimity.

The purification of the three spheres from the beginning of all dharmas is the meaning of emptiness, the purification of the future is the meaning of separation, and the purification of the present is the meaning of non-self.
SÄgaramati!
If bodhisattvas, regarding these profound dharmas that are unborn and unceasing, free from words and equal to space, enter into the equality of wisdom in accordance with and in violation of [them],
If one is able to contemplate and observe in this way, in accordance with reality, then that bodhisattva will be able to pierce the jewel of the mind set on omniscience without destroying it.
Although one may thus pierce the mind set on omniscience, there is no enlightenment. One is then able to realize the principle of mastery over all dharmas.

It is like the sun and moon, each dwelling in its own palace, universally illuminating the four continents, yet the sun and moon gods are completely unaware, and do not think, I go to all places or I do not go to illuminate. It is simply due to the power of the karmic retribution of the merit of all beings that there is such illumination.
SÄgaramati!
That bodhisattva who possesses the wisdom of skillful discrimination is also like this.

Although he extensively benefits sentient beings in immeasurable buddha-lands, that bodhisattva is completely unaware, never giving rise to thoughts of various intentions, yet his actions appear as they should.
Moreover, SÄgaramati!
If a bodhisattva is endowed with discerning wisdom, he should contemplate in accordance with principle within the perfection of concentration and the perfection of wisdom.
Why is this?
A bodhisattva who abides in a concentrated mind does not cultivate the Dharma of contemplation, and a bodhisattva who cultivates the practice of contemplation does not abide in a concentrated mind.
If one further cultivates the practice of contemplation, then one will have wisdom. Due to having wisdom, one is able to contemplate well.
What is contemplated?
It is called contemplating the true characteristics of all dharmas.
What are the true characteristics of all dharmas?
If one does not engage in any characteristics, this is precisely the true characteristics of all dharmas.
What are the characteristics of all dharmas?
It refers to that which is indicated as the characteristics of all dharmas.
The true characteristics within such an indication are also called the true characteristics of all dharmas.
If one understands in this way, one will be able to realize the absence of characteristics and the absence of the absence of characteristics.ğŸ”½What are characteristics?
What is the absence of characteristics?
The characteristics are birth, and the absence of characteristics is cessation. If there are neither characteristics nor the absence of characteristics, then there is neither birth nor cessation.

If dharmas have neither birth nor cessation, then the nature of all dharmas is originally and always abiding, the dharma realm is indestructible, suchness is unmoving, and the ultimate truth is unchanging.
This dharma nature is called the true understanding and realization of the arising of conditioned phenomena.
Awakening to the true characteristics of all dharmas, directly realizing the non-dual ultimate truth, this is known by the wisdom of direct perception.
Samudradatta!
This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva who possesses the wisdom of discernment.
